messages.subject: Re: recorders Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Unschooling music
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/20/02 6:00:22 PM, cottrellbentley@cox.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/20/02 6:00:22 PM, cottrellbentley@... writes:

<< What is a good online source for a good quality recorder? The only ones
I've found locally are either made so cheaply that the notes don't sound
right, or they are encased so that they can't be touched until they are
purchased.
>>

Get a Yamaha plastic. No sense getting an expensive wooden one until you
know whether you're really going to enjoy it.

If you find a site with some for sale and want to contact me on the side I
can advise you.

Sandra

messages.subject: recorders Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Unschooling music
messages.msgSnippet: What is a good online source for a good quality recorder?  The only ones I ve found locally are either made so cheaply that the notes don t sound right, or
messages.messageBody:
What is a good online source for a good quality recorder? The only ones
I've found locally are either made so cheaply that the notes don't sound
right, or they are encased so that they can't be touched until they are
purchased.

Many thanks!
-Lisa

> Recorder is a precursor to all those woodwinds with all the keys that cover
> up little bitty holes way away, and some keys that cover up two or three
> holes down below.
